intro: Diodia rosmarinifolia, commonly known as wild thyme or lemon verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diodia rosmarinifolia is often used in herbal remedies and as a ornamental plant due to its pleasant fragrance and hardy nature.
